009package imagingbook.common.geometry.homography;

011import java.util.Locale;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Quaternion;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Rotation;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
017import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
018import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
020
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;

024/**
025 * Static utility methods used for camera calibration.
026 * @author WB
027 *
028 */
029public class MathUtil {
030
031        static {
032                Locale.setDefault(Locale.US);
033        }
034
035        public static void print(String name, RealMatrix M) {
036                System.out.println(name);
037                for (int r = 0; r < M.getRowDimension(); r++) {
038                        RealVector row = M.getRowVector(r);
039                        System.out.println("  " + r + " " + row.toString());
040                }
041        }
042
043        public static void print(String name, RealVector v) {
044                System.out.println(name + v.toString());
045        }
046
047        // -------------------------------------------------------
048
049        public static RealVector[] getColumnVectors(RealMatrix M) {
050                final int ncols = M.getColumnDimension();
051                RealVector[] colVecs = new  RealVector[ncols];
052                for (int col = 0; col < ncols; col++) {
053                        colVecs[col] = M.getColumnVector(col);
054                }
055                return colVecs;
056        }
057
058        public static RealVector crossProduct3x3(RealVector A, RealVector B) {
059                final double[] a = A.toArray();
060                final double[] b = B.toArray();
061                final double[] c = {
062                                a[1] * b[2] - b[1] * a[2],
063                                a[2] * b[0] - b[2] * a[0],
064                                a[0] * b[1] - b[0] * a[1]
065                };
066                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(c);
067        }
068
069        public static double det(RealMatrix M) {
070                return new LUDecomposition(M).getDeterminant();
071        }
072
073        public static RealVector getRowPackedVector(RealMatrix A) {
074                double[][] AA = A.getData();
075                double[] V = new double[AA.length * AA[0].length];
076                int k = 0;
077                for (int i = 0; i < AA.length; i++) {
078                        for (int j = 0; j < AA[0].length; j++) {
079                                V[k++] = AA[i][j];
080                        }
081                }
082                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(V);
083        }
084
085        public static RealMatrix fromRowPackedVector(RealVector V, int rows, int columns) {
086                double[][] AA = new double[rows][columns];
087                double[] data = V.toArray();
088                int k = 0;
089                for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) {
090                        for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) {
091                                AA[i][j] = data[k++];
092                        }
093                }
094                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(AA);
095        }
096

138
139
140        /**               
141         * Finds a nontrivial solution (x) to the homogeneous linear system M . x = 0
142         * by singular-value decomposition. If M has more rows than columns, the
143         * system of equations is overdetermined. In this case the returned solution
144         * minimizes the residual ||M . x|| in the least-squares sense.
145         * 
146         * @param A     the original matrix.
147         * @return the solution vector x.
148         */
149        public static RealVector solveHomogeneousSystem(RealMatrix A) {
150                SingularValueDecomposition svd = new SingularValueDecomposition(A);
151                RealMatrix V = svd.getV();
152                RealVector x = V.getColumnVector(V.getColumnDimension() - 1);
153                return x;
154        }
155
156        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] cvec) {
157                double[] hvec = new double[cvec.length + 1];
158                for (int i = 0; i < cvec.length; i++) {
159                        hvec[i] = cvec[i];
160                        hvec[hvec.length - 1] = 1;
161                }
162                return hvec;
163        }
164
165        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] hvec) {
166                double[] cvec = new double[hvec.length - 1];
167                final double s = 1 / hvec[hvec.length - 1];     // TODO: check for zero factor
168                for (int i = 0; i < hvec.length - 1; i++) {
169                        cvec[i] = s * hvec[i];
170                }
171                return cvec;
172        }
173

200
201        public static String getInfo(double[][] A) {
202                return String.format("Matrix: rows=%d, columns=%d", A.length, A[0].length);
203        }
204
205        public static String getInfo(double[] x) {
206                return String.format("Vector: dimension=%d", x.length);
207        }
208
209        public static double mean(double[] x) {
210                final int n = x.length;
211                if (n == 0) 
212                        return 0;
213                double sum = 0;
214                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
215                        sum = sum + x[i];
216                }
217                return sum / n;
218        }
219
220        /**
221         * 
222         * @param x a sequence of real values 
223         * @return the variance of the values in x (sigma^2)
224         */
225        public static double variance(double[] x) {
226                final int n = x.length;
227                if (n == 0) 
228                        return 0;
229                double sum = 0;
230                double sum2 = 0;
231                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
232                        sum = sum + x[i];
233                        sum2 = sum2 + x[i] * x[i];
234                }
235                return (sum2 - (sum * sum) / n) / n;
236        }
237
238        public static RealMatrix getNormalisationMatrix(Pnt2d[] pnts) {
239                final int N = pnts.length;
240                double[] x = new double[N];
241                double[] y = new double[N];
242
243                for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
244                        x[i] = pnts[i].getX();
245                        y[i] = pnts[i].getY();
246                }
247
248                // calculate the means in x/y
249                double meanx = MathUtil.mean(x);
250                double meany = MathUtil.mean(y);
251
252                // calculate the variances in x/y
253                double varx = MathUtil.variance(x);
254                double vary = MathUtil.variance(y);
255
256                double sx = Math.sqrt(2 / varx);
257                double sy = Math.sqrt(2 / vary);
258
259                RealMatrix matrixA = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] {
260                        { sx,  0, -sx * meanx},
261                        {  0, sy, -sy * meany},
262                        {  0,  0,           1 }});
263
264                return matrixA;
265        }
266
267
268        // Utility method
269        public static double[] transform(double[] p, RealMatrix M3x3) {
270                if (p.length != 2) {
271                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("transform(): vector p must be of length 2 but is " + p.length);
272                }
273                double[] pA = MathUtil.toHomogeneous(p);
274                double[] pAt = M3x3.operate(pA);
275                return MathUtil.toCartesian(pAt); // need to de-homogenize, since pAt[2] == 1?
276        }
277

302        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
303
304        public static Quaternion toQuaternion(Rotation r) {
305                return new Quaternion(r.getQ0(), r.getQ1(), r.getQ2(), r.getQ3());
306        }
307
308        public static Rotation toRotation(Quaternion q) {
309                return new Rotation(q.getQ0(), q.getQ1(), q.getQ2(), q.getQ3(), true);
310        }
311
312        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
313        
314        public static void main(String[] args) {
315                System.out.println("Solving A.x = 0 (for A being n x 3, exact and least squares)");
316                {
317                        double[][] A = {{1, 2, 3}, {4, 5, 6}, {9, 8, 0}};
318                        RealVector x = solveHomogeneousSystem(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A));
319                        System.out.println("\nA = \n" + Matrix.toString(A));
320                        System.out.println("Solution = " + x.toString());
321                        // Solution = {0.649964237; -0.7338780288; 0.1974070146}
322                }
323                {
324                        double[][] A = {{1, 2, 3}, {4, 5, 6}, {9, 8, 0}, {-3, 7, 2}};
325                        RealVector x = solveHomogeneousSystem(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A));
326                        System.out.println("\nA = \n" + Matrix.toString(A));
327                        System.out.println("Solution = " + x.toString());
328                        // Solution = {0.2311474408; -0.5001889485; 0.8344949828}
329                }
330
331        }
